channel.title: november-2022-update on Scott French
channel.description: Recent content in november-2022-update on Scott French

item.title: November 2022 Update
item.description: Fall is upon us and another busy time of year has come again. I missed the October website update and November is almost over! In October my family got a new Great Dane puppy named Juno. For now she's a lot of work (and puppies can be quite annoying), but we're looking forward to her being a great companion to our older Dane, Freya. Lots of family joy celebrating the new crew member and learning how to best take care of her together.

item.title: Mesa Boogie Mark III / IIIC+ with 105PT & STR-415/416 Imbuia
item.description: If you're looking for the best possible Mark III then you can stop here, you've found it. This is a 1985 Mesa Boogie Mark III. It's an early no-stripe version released just after the Mark IIC+, and being a transition model they share a few common elements. The 105 power transformer and heavier faceplate are carried over from the IIC+. This is a DRG, meaning Simul-class, Reverb, and Graphic EQ options.

item.title: Mesa Boogie Mark III Black Stripe DRG Imbuia Combo
item.description: This is a 1985 MESA/Boogie Mark III Combo. It is a DRG model, which means Simul-Class power section, Reverb, and Graphic EQ. This is a black/no-stripe revision which is the first of the Mark IIIs. Some early black/no-stripe examples share several features with the Mark IIC+. First, this amp has the early-style etched face plate where all the lines and text are metal instead of white paint. These hold up a lot better than the painted face plates.

item.title: Mesa Boogie Mark III Blue Stripe DRG Imbuia Combo
item.description: You're looking at a 1988 Mesa Boogie Mark III Blue Stripe Combo. It is a DRG, meaning Simul-class power, Reverb, and Graphic EQ. It also has an Electro-Voice EVM-12L 12" speaker. The cabinet is unmarked, but it looks like other cabinets I've had that were marked Imbuia. This is basically a fully loaded Mark III with all the preferred features. On top of all that, it already has the factory R2 volume mod and reverb fix.

item.title: Mesa Boogie Mark III Purple Stripe DRG Imbuia Combo
item.description: This is a 1986 Mesa Boogie Mark III Purple Stripe Combo in Imbuya and Wicker. As far as I know this amp is 100% original. Features include Graphic EQ, Reverb, and Simul-Class which would make this a DRG. Also includes the iconic Electro Voice EVM-12L speaker. Chassis mount is SUS-4. Original vinyl cover is quite worn out. Does the job but doesn't look very good. You can judge the condition for yourself based on the photos.
